author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Communist Party of India (Marxist Leninst) is conducting a one day meet in Kumbakonam on Wednesday on preventing the plunder of natural resources in the Cauvery delta and to urge the Centre to declare the region as exclusive protected agricultural zone to ensure sustainable livelihood resources for millions of workers.

Informing the media about details of the event, CPI (M-L) People’s Liberation general secretary Balan said the meet would highlight the plunder and over exploitation of the available natural resources, including water, natural gas, and other mineral wealth over the past few decades, how that had impacted negatively the economy of the region and its people.

Natural methane gas and shale gas exploitation, establishment of atomic and thermal power plants along the coasts were some of the threats to the State. No political party was speaking up against the issues and coming forward to sensitise the public on the issues for their own gains. The meet would stress on the need to end any and all investigations that seek to devastate the fertile climate of the delta region, Mr. Balan said.
title: CPI(ML) to hold meeting on ecological threats
